Bananas

A banana is an edible fruit â€“ botanically & biologically a berry â€“ produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musayy.

In some countries and continents, bananas used for cooking may be called â€œplantainsâ€, distinguishing them from dessert bananas. The fruit is variable in size, color, and firmness, but is usually elongated and curved, with soft flesh rich in starch covered with a rind, which may be green, yellow, red, purple, or brown when ripe.
